metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2312 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Turning all screens off in Plasma-workspace and kscreenlocker while the lock screen is shown can result in the screen being unlocked when turning a screen on again.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2312` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libkworkspace5-5 - 4:5.5.4-0ubuntu1
libplasma-geolocation-interface5 - 4:5.5.4-0ubuntu1
libtaskmanager5 - 4:5.5.4-0ubuntu1
libweather-ion7 - 4:5.5.4-0ubuntu1
plasma-workspace - 4:5.5.4-0ubuntu1
plasma-workspace-wayland - 4:5.5.4-0ubuntu1
sddm-theme-breeze - 4:5.5.4-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> the xenial plasma-workspace package is very different; I suspect it's not-affected but I can't say that definitively nor state where the affected code might live in xenial.

criterions.comment: plasma-workspace package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:5.5.4-0ubuntu1').
